learning_outcomes.description: Analyse electrical engineering problems to determine where computational techniques in matrix algebra, stochastic systems and optimisation theory can be applied.
Interpret the theoretical foundations of matrix algebra, stochastic systems and optimisation theory
Design solutions for electrical engineering problems by applying key algorithms in matrix algebra, stochastic systems and optimisation theory
Implement computational techniques in MATLAB with a high level of proficiency

assessments.task_description: The assignments will be designed to develop skills in problem solving based on the theory presented in lectures on the first part (optimisation), often using MATLAB.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Submit the assignment (report and code) via the Blackboard turnitin assignment submission system.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.due_date:
17/09/2024 6:00 pm

The exam will take place outside of scheduled class time from 6:00 pm to 8:00 pm on 17/09/24.
assessments.task_description:
This exam will take place outside of scheduled class time (6:00-8:00pm, 17/09/24) and will cover the Optimisation part. 

The test will be 90 minutes in duration. This test will be closed-book and may contain multiple-choice, short-answer, and problem-solving questions.

Multiple choice assessment is not used for over 50% of the test.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

assessments.category: Computer Code, Paper/ Report/ Annotation, Tutorial/ Problem Set
assessments.task_description:
There are three parts in this assignment.

In the first part, the assignment questions will be designed to develop skills in problem-solving based on the theory presented in lectures on Optimisation, often using MATLAB.

In the second part, the assignment questions will be designed to develop skills in problem-solving based on the theory presented in lectures on Linear Algebra, often using MATLAB.

In the third part, students must prepare a report and presentation. Presentation details will be provided in the specification of Assignment 2.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Submit the assignment (report and code) via the Blackboard turnitin assignment submission system.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description: The final exam covers linear algebra and stochastic processes parts.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.
